Robin Elizabeth Halpern, the daughter of Elizabeth Murrell Halpern of Hampden, Me., and the late Gordon A. Halpern, was married yesterday to Michael Thomas Cavanaugh III, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Cavanaugh Jr. of Holyoke, Mass. The Rev. Elaine Beth Peresluha officiated at the Unitarian Universalist Society of Bangor, Me. The Rev. Joseph J. Koury, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Trinity College in Hartford.

Mrs. Cavanaugh, 31, is the manager of private dining at the Lotos Club in New York. She is the president of the Trinity Club of New York. Her father was the executive director of the Bangor Children's Home and Hilltop School, a preschool and kindergarten in Bangor. Her mother, who retired as a special education teacher at Weatherby Elementary School in Hampden, manages the Kimball Shop Boutique in Northeast Harbor, Me.

Mr. Cavanaugh, 32, is an associate in institutional stock sales at Lazard Freres & Company, the New York investment bank. He received an M.B.A. from Vanderbilt University. His mother retired as an assistant to the director of admissions at Mount Holyoke College. His father is an independent sporting goods sales representative in Holyoke.
